summary: This is an email chain from November 2021 regarding the release of U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) documents for use in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The documents contain border crossing records for three named individuals and the email identifies a CBP witness available to testify.

persons.name: Everdell
persons.context: The recipient of the CBP's response regarding the release of border crossing records for use in the Maxwell case. He initially requested the information via subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the ongoing criminal proceedings (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell) for which the CBP documents are being released.

persons.name: Chief CBPO Best
persons.context: Identified as the U.S. Customs and Border Protection witness available to provide testimony related to the released documents.

connections.description: Everdell is an attorney requesting documents for use in the criminal case against Maxwell, indicating he is part of her legal defense team.
Chief CBPO Best is identified as a law enforcement witness available to testify in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Initial Document Request via Subpoena
events.description: Attorney Everdell initially requested border crossing records for three individuals via subpoena for the Maxwell case.

events.title: Follow-up Conversation on Document Request
events.description: A follow-up conversation occurred where the scope of the requested CBP documents was altered and it was confirmed they would be subject to the existing protective order.

events.title: CBP Response and Document Release
events.description: CBP sent a response and released password-protected, redacted border crossing records for use in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: U.S. Customs and Border Protection One World Trade Center, 50th Floor, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a 2021 email regarding the release of U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) records for the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The released CBP documents contain border crossing records for three named individuals (names not specified in this excerpt).
The documents are password-protected, redacted, and subject to a strict protective order for use only in the Maxwell case.
Chief CBPO Best is identified as the CBP witness available to testify regarding these border crossing records.
